column2: PA DMV PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
1. A driver can legally pass on the right of another vehicle:
column4: that is preparing to turn left, if there is room to go by safely.
column8: None of the other answers is correct.
column10: anytime, if the vehicle is a bicycle.

column2: 2. This sign warns drivers that:
column6: they will soon be facing oncoming traffic.

column2: 3. If an emergency vehicle with flashing lights is traveling in the area where you are driving, you must:
column4: proceed slowly and let the vehicle pass.
column8: drive to the right side of the road and stop.
column10: stop immediately and let the vehicle pass.

column2: 4. What do warning signs mean?
column4: Drivers are approaching a hazardous location.
column8: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.

column2: 5. Before passing another vehicle, you should signal:
column4: early enough so other drivers know your intention.

column2: 6. When entering a highway from an entrance ramp, drivers should:
column4: drive above the speed of traffic to get ahead.
column6: enter slowly to avoid other vehicles.
column8: accelerate to the speed of traffic.
column10: stop first, then gradually enter traffic.

column2: 7. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column6: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.
column8: you increase the chance of a crash.

column2: 8. You must stop when you see a:
9. This sign means:
10. This sign means:
11. If you stop at a railroad crossing with more than one track:
column4: proceed with caution until you see a train.
column6: go through when one of the tracks is free.
column8: wait until you have a clear view of both tracks.
column10: go through as soon as the first train passes.

column2: 12. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column4: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.
column8: It is  hard to judge how far away a motorcycle is.

column2: 13. Drivers who eat and drink while driving:
column8: may have trouble controlling their vehicles.

column2: 14. When following motorcycles, drivers should:
column4: try to pass them as they have different braking capabilities than other motor vehicles.
column8: keep less space in front of their vehicle.
column10: keep more space in front of their vehicle.

column2: 15. This sign warns drivers of:
column8: a low place in the road.

column2: 16. Crashes in work zones are most commonly caused by:
17. This sign means:
column6: The traffic signal is not operational

column2: 18. The following symptoms are associated with drowsy driving:
column4: You don’t remember driving the last few miles.
column8: Your eyes go out of focus by themselves.
